Alter Dweomer.name: Alter Dweomer
Alter Dweomer.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Requirements The dweomercat cub was targeted by a spell or was within the area of a spell as it was cast since its last turn;

Effect The dweomercat cub gains an effect related to the school of the triggering spell. Other than the damage, the effect lasts for [[/r 1d4]] rounds or until the dweomercat cub Dismisses the effect, whichever comes first.

  • Abjuration The cub gains a +1 status bonus to AC.
  • Conjuration A cloud of fog appears in a 5-foot burst centered on a corner of the cub's space. Anything in the cloud is concealed.
  • Divination The cub gains a +1 status bonus to skill checks.
  • Enchantment The cub gains a +1 status bonus to saves.
  • Evocation Magical feedback deals 1d6 force damage for every 2 levels you have to the triggering spellcaster (basic Reflex save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher).
  • Illusion The cub becomes invisible. This effect ends if the cub uses a hostile action, in addition to the normal end conditions.
  • Necromancy The cub gains temporary HP equal to your level.
  • Transmutation The cub gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls.

Become Shadow.name: Become Shadow
Become Shadow.description:
The shadow familiar transforms its body into barely tangible shadow. It gains resistance to all damage (except force) equal to half your level but can't use any actions requiring a physical form. The familiar can also slip through gaps at least 2 inches wide, or 1 inch wide if it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}. It can use this action again to return to its normal form.

This action has the trait matching your tradition of magic, or occult if you aren't a spellcaster.

Breath Weapon (House Drake).name: Breath Weapon (House Drake)
Breath Weapon (House Drake).description: The house drake breathes a @Template[type:cone|distance:10] of silver mist. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round. The house drake can't use Breath Weapon or Silver Infusion for [[/r 1d4]] rounds.

Elemental Breath.name: Elemental Breath
Elemental Breath.description:
Frequency once per hour

The scamp breathes elemental matter in a @Template[type:cone|distance:10]. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[(floor((@actor.level+1)/2))d6|traits:area-damage] damage for every 2 levels you have, with a basic @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. The damage type depends on the type of scamp.

Emote.name: Emote
Emote.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The cloud of sentiment changes the expression on its miniature face.
It prepares to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} you on a skill check for a skill matching its expression: Deception for an inscrutable expression, Diplomacy for a friendly expression, or Intimidation for an angry expression. It gains a reaction this round, which it can use only to Aid you in this way. It automatically succeeds at its check to Aid you with the skill or automatically critically succeeds if you're a master of the skill in question.

Euphoric Breath.name: Euphoric Breath
Euphoric Breath.description:
Frequency Once per hour

Effect The fey dragonet breathes euphoric gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:10]. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/r 1d4]] rounds; on a critical failure, the duration is 1 minute.

Ferocious Will.name: Ferocious Will
Ferocious Will.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You succeed at a saving throw against a magical mental effect;

Effect You send a blast of magical feedback at the effect's source, dealing @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)|basic] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher) to that creature.

On a failed save, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Fiendish Temptation.name: Fiendish Temptation
Fiendish Temptation.description:
Frequency once per day.

Effect The imp offers a non-fiend within 15 feet a bargain, granting a boon of good luck @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-effects.Item.0zZUwMQW9bgJ2sZd]{Fiendish Temptation} if the creature accepts. The boon lasts for 1 hour once accepted.

Once during the hour, the creature can roll an attack roll or saving throw twice and use the higher result.

If the creature dies while the boon is in place, the imp decides where the creature's soul travels. This typically makes the soul bound for eternity in the imp's home plane, and the creature is unable to be raised or resurrected except by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual or similar magic.

Forage.name: Forage
Forage.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect A grindle-drake is adept at finding sustenance for itself in almost any environment. The grindle-drake recovers a number of Hit Points equal to half your level.

@Damage[(floor(@actor.master.level/2))[healing]]

Gibe.name: Gibe
Gibe.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The mockingfey takes on the imperfect, illusory appearance of a creature it can see within 60 feet, pantomiming the mannerisms in a derisive fashion. This illusion doesn't make the mockingfey look any larger and lasts until the end of your next turn.
The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is the higher. Regardless of the result, the creature is immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{off-guard} until the start of your next turn, as it's distracted by your familiar's taunts.

Critical Failure The creature is off-guard until the end of your next turn

Haunting Melody.name: Haunting Melody
Haunting Melody.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The nosoi croons an entrancing song.
Each living or undead creature within a 60-foot emanation must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher, or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for 1 round.
A nosoi can use a 2-action activity, which has the auditory, concentrate, divine, enchantment, and mental traits, to force affected creatures to attempt another @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save; on a failure, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for an additional round.
A creature that succeeds at any save or has its fascination broken is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
Despite being a mental effect, this ability affects mindless undead.
Psychopomps are immune to this ability.

Ink Spray.name: Ink Spray
Ink Spray.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes;

Effect The wyrm splatters ink in a @Template[type:cone|distance:10]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save with a DC equal to its master's spell DC or class DC, whichever is higher.

Critical Success The creture is unaffected.

Success If the creature was invisible, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{concealed} instead for 2 rounds.

Failure As success, but for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but for 10 minutes. The creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{blinded} for 1 round or until it wipes the ink from its eyes using an Interact action

Kick Up Dust.name: Kick Up Dust
Kick Up Dust.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect Your dust bunny shakes and kicks to stir up dust in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5]. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. A creature that fails its save begins sneezing uncontrollably and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and cannot take reactions for 1 round; on a critical failure they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}.

Little Wish.name: Little Wish
Little Wish.description:
Frequency once per day;

Effect Trigger A creature the gennayn can see that is within 60 feet attempts a saving throw or skill check

Effect The gennayn reshapes reality in a small way to twist fate, allowing the creature to reroll the saving throw or skill check.

Orc Ferocity (Ferocious Beasts).name: Orc Ferocity (Ferocious Beasts)
Orc Ferocity (Ferocious Beasts).description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not immediately killed.

Fierceness in battle runs through your blood, and you refuse to fall from your injuries no matter how terrible they may be. You avoid being knocked out and remain at 1 Hit Point, and your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} condition increases by 1.

If you have the Undying Ferocity feat, your familiar resists death's clutches with supernatural vigor, daring death to claim you while promising that any such attempt will surely fail. When they use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.PlhPpdwIV0rIAJ8K]{Orc Ferocity}, they gain temporary Hit Points equal to their level.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.Px4E3Hyx2pmvSWAA]{Effect: Undying Ferocity}

Polong Possession.name: Polong Possession
Polong Possession.description:
The polong attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature.
The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.
On a failure, the polong merges into the creature's body for 1 minute (24 hours on a critical failure). The polong can observe through the creature's senses but is unable to control the creature. The possessed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} while the possession lasts.
While possessing a creature, a polong can ignore the distance and line of effect limitation from its anchored incorporeality ability; when the possession ends, it immediately returns to the bottle if it's beyond range.

Silver Infusion.name: Silver Infusion
Silver Infusion.description:
Your house drake breathes on one of your weapons. Until the start of your next turn, that weapon counts as silver instead of its normal material for any physical damage it deals. The house drake can't use Breath Weapon or Silver Infusion for [[/r 1d4]] rounds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-effects.Item.xDi0KLSjVdiGEkiH]{Effect: Silver Infusion}

Spiritual Recall.name: Spiritual Recall
Spiritual Recall.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger An attack would reduce your familiar to 0 Hit Points

Effect You use your bond to rescue your familiar. The familiar survives the attack with 1 Hit Point remaining and becomes incorporeal until the end of your next turn.

Steal Shadow.name: Steal Shadow
Steal Shadow.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The shadow familiar makes a melee attack with an attack roll modifier equal to your spell attack roll modifier. If the Strike is successful, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and its shadow disappears. After 24 hours, the enfeebled condition ends, and they regain their shadow once more. Any effect that reduces or removes the enfeebled condition restores their shadow as well.

This action has the trait matching your tradition of magic, or occult if you aren't a spellcaster.

Steam Screen.name: Steam Screen
Steam Screen.description:
Frequency once per minute;

Effect Your clockwork familiar blows a billowing plume of steam into its square around itself. It gains a +1 circumstance bonus to its Intimidation checks, and any creature in the familiar's square has concealment, though creatures in the square can't use this concealment to Hide or Sneak.

The steam and its effects remain for 1 round.

To use this ability, your clockwork familiar must spend 1 hour of operational time.

Sure and Steady.name: Sure and Steady
Sure and Steady.description: When placing all six legs on any ground or on stone flooring, a grindle-drake can extract knowledge about the surface under its feet in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] in all directions. This knowledge can include whether the ground is enchanted, hollow, treacherous, or otherwise different than it appears. The grindle-drake can then communicate this information through touch telepathy.

Toggle Standby Mode.name: Toggle Standby Mode
Toggle Standby Mode.description: Your clockwork familiar enters standby mode. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a –2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when you Command it to exit standby mode, it does so, by using this action again.

Turn of Fate.name: Turn of Fate
Turn of Fate.description:
Frequency once per day;

Range 30 feet

Effect

Your ceru shifts the scales of fortune for one target's next attempt at an attack roll, saving throw, or skill check.

If targeted with bad fortune, the target attempts a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.master.attributes.classOrSpellDC.value)] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher, with effects depending on the result of their save; this is a misfortune effect.

If targeted with good fortune, the target rolls twice and uses the better result; this is a fortune effect.

Regardless of outcome, targets are immune to Turn of Fate for one day.

Success The target is unaffected. 

Failure The target rolls twice and uses the worse result.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target is affected for the next three attempts.
